response.answer_text: Most Americans know little or nothing about the ancient Greeks, except for what they might have seen in a movie. If you are going to study art, history, classics (obviously), philosophy, literature, theology, or linguistics ancient Greece is worth knowing about. It is worthwhile to point out to science students that Aristotle taught that heavy things fall faster than light things. This is why empirical science is how we actually understand how the natural world works, and why philosophy is an impediment or at best useless for the task.

Most Americans approving the idiomatic expression “that's ancient history” cannot benefit from what they curse. The benefit from learning Greek is get rid of computer voodoo Algebra.
